item.title: Steph add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Steph add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Never to go on trips with anyone you do not love." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Steph add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Steph add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Steph add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Language is courage: the ability to conceive a thought, to speak it, and by doing so to make it true." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Steph add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Steph add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Steph add a quote by Robert James Waller
item.description: "Analysis destroys wholes. Some things, magic things, are meant to stay whole. If you look at their pieces, they go away." -- Robert James Waller

item.title: Steph add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Steph add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Steph add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Unexpected intrusions of beauty. This is what life is." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Steph add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Steph add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Love is the extremely difficult realization that something other than oneself is real." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Steph add a quote by William Ernest Henley
item.description: "It matters not how strait the gate, How charged with punishments the scroll, I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul." -- William Ernest Henley

item.title: Steph add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "You are suffering from an ailment that affects ladies of romantic imaginations. Symptoms include fainting, weariness, loss of appetite, low spirits. While on one level the crisis can be ascribed to wandering about in freezing rain without the benefit of adequate waterproofing, the deeper cause is more likely to be found in some emotional trauma. However, unlike the heroines of your favorite novels, your constitution has not been weakened by the privations of life in earlier, harsher centuries. No tuberculosis, no childhood polio, no unhygienic living conditions. You'll survive.' " pg. 303" -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Steph add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Do a loony-goony dance 'Cross the kitchen floor, Put something silly in the world That ain't been there before." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Steph add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Steph add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Not one of your pertinent ancestors was squashed, devoured, drowned, starved, stranded, stuck fast, untimely wounded, or otherwise deflected from its life's quest of delivering a tiny charge of genetic material to the right partner at the right moment in order to perpetuate the only possible sequence of hereditary combinations that could result -- eventually, astoundingly, and all too briefly -- in you." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Steph add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Steph add a quote by M.L. Stedman
item.description: "He’s lived the life he’s lived. He’s loved the woman he’s loved. No one ever has or ever will travel quite the same path on this earth, and that’s all right by him." -- M.L. Stedman

item.title: Steph add a quote by Ludovic Halévy
item.description: "Love is a rebellious bird, that nobody can tame, and you call him quite in vain, if it suits him not to come." -- Ludovic Halévy

item.title: Steph add a quote by Moliere
item.description: "Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit." -- Moliere

item.title: Steph add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Steph add a quote by George Moore
item.description: "We humans are more complicated than animals, and we love through the imagination." -- George Moore

item.title: Steph add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be." -- John Cheever
